worker.title: Hiring Foreign Workers Process
worker.desc: Helping companies understand the full process of employing foreign workers, from recruitment to onboarding, including staffing, visa application, and local support in Japan.
worker.category: For companies with questions about hiring foreigners in Japan
worker.alt: foreign worker hiring process Japan employment
worker.a1: We support companies with talent matching, interview arrangements, employment contract drafting, pre-departure orientation, and onboarding assistance.
worker.q2: Our company has never hired foreigners before. Can you help?
worker.a2: Yes, we guide companies step by step, starting from explaining the system and completing the necessary procedures.
worker.q3: Will language skills be a barrier?
worker.a3: We evaluate candidates’ Japanese language proficiency in advance and can arrange language training programs to ensure smooth adaptation.
worker.q4: How early should we start preparing?
worker.a4: We recommend starting at least 2–3 months in advance to match visa processing and pre-employment preparation.

price.a2: Yes. If the employee leaves within the guarantee period, we provide free replacement matching or partial refunds.
price.q3: Does the service include post-employment support?

price.a4: Yes, we can provide online Japanese courses or arrange group training according to company needs.

visa.title: Visa and Legal Details
visa.desc: Explaining visa types such as Specified Skilled Worker and Engineer/Specialist in Humanities/International Services, with complete application guidance and FAQ.

visa.q1: What types of visas can foreigners apply for?
visa.a1: Common types include Specified Skilled Worker and Engineer/Specialist in Humanities/International Services. We recommend the most suitable type depending on the case.
visa.q2: How long is the visa valid?
visa.a2: Initial validity is usually 1 year, and can be extended to 3 or 5 years depending on the applicant.
visa.a3: Academic certificates, CV, job description, employment contract, etc. We provide full support throughout the preparation.
visa.q4: What if the visa application is rejected?
visa.a4: We analyze the reason and assist with reapplication or recommend alternative visa options.

stortText: “Formosa” is more than just a place name — it's where we began. As a Taiwan-based recruitment agency, FORMA is dedicated to bridging cultural and geographic boundaries by connecting talents from Taiwan and Asia with Japanese companies seeking global growth. We specialize in study-abroad support, language school placement, and manpower services in Japan, offering comprehensive solutions from school applications and pre-departure guidance to local support and Specified Skilled Worker job matching. At FORMA, we believe that every step across borders opens the door to new possibilities.
title_Formosa: Reflecting our Taiwanese origin, embracing diverse cultures and passion—this is the foundation of our cross-cultural mission.
title_Opportunity: We strive to create fresh opportunities for both businesses and talent, turning possibilities into tangible growth.
title_Resource: By building networks and integrating international resources, we help clients overcome cultural and regional barriers.
title_Momentum: Relentless advancement and accelerated growth fuel our core drive as we move forward together with you.
title_Alliance: Progressing hand in hand with our clients, we emphasize the power of alliances for shared success.
